issue.title: [CF 567] Font size for custom text layouts does not seem to work...
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create a custom text layout (not the default).
2. Add a text display to the custom layout, or modify an existing one.
3. Make sure a button uses that custom text layout, enter some text.
4. Change the font on the custom text layout -> font changes on the button text.
5. Change the font size on the custom text layout -> font size does NOT change for the button text.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
I expect the font size to change, just like the font changed.  :)

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.0.3 r567 (taken from the main config window)

Do you have an error log of what happened?
No

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
In particular, it is the "Big CD Layout 1" custom text display, and the font size 'seems' to be ignored in all circumstances.

> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav | Imported from CurseForge issue #567 | Raw

comments.body:
The way that Blizzard has implemented font sizes is kinda weird. However, it may be the case that TMW is doing something wrong.

Either way, its worth mentioning that there is essentially a hard "cap" on text font size that can be difficult to reach, especially in an implementation where the parents of the text (icons and groups) can be scaled.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Cybeloras,

I tried a variety of sizes (small to large) and could not see any change. The profile I uploaded is just where I left the font-size at when I filed the bug.


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav

You are indeed at the font size cap. If you scale down your icons, and then adjust the font size, you will see that it does respond to changes in the setting.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

So why am I unable to scale either up or down, just because the icon is larger? There has to be a range of size ... I actually want the text smaller. I can understand a maximum or minimum size ... but it's not allowing any resizing at all.


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav

Unfortunately, that's the way it works. I don't like it either, but its the way that Blizzard has decided to do it, so there is nothing that can be done.

The only thing that I can think of, and I have no idea if it would work or not, would be to use a font that has artificially small letters. I don't know of any that exist, and it might be a stretch because I don't have any idea how fonts are made, but it might be something worth looking into.

Edited Aug 31, 2012
